name: UTS: Universal Tab Separated file format
short_description:
The great thing about standards is that there are so many to choose from.

The ubiquitous comma separated values file format (.csv) has a sibling known as a .tsv: a tab-separated values file. .tsv files are easy to read, easy to parse, and easy to manipulate.

The bioinformatics field has a plethora of file formats used to share various types of information, including genetic sequences, gene calls, expression and confidence values, relation information, and many others. Data from these different file types often need to be shared with each other, which is problematic if neither file type supports storing all of the information required.

The UTS file format (and the parser being developed here) allows for an almost unlimited array of values to be stored in a single file that can then be used to produce more specialized file formats (and varieties of these formats) while allowing for comprehensive integration and easy manipulation of the data via a simple .tsv format.
